key_events.description: Itaúsa announced a bonus share issue of 2 new shares for every 100 shares held on 2025-12-15, with new shares credited on 2025-12-23 and a record date of 2025-12-18. Shareholders can trade fractions from 2025-12-26 to 2026-01-26.

Itaúsa's capital increased to R$ 83,689,000,000.00 on 2025-12-15 through capitalization of reserves of R$ 2,500,000,000.00, issuing 219,876,212 new shares. Previously, on 2024-11-12, a capital increase of R$ 7 billion was approved, raising capital stock from R$ 73.189 billion to R$ 80.189 billion.

Itaúsa announced dividend and JCP payments on 2025-12-09, with shareholder remuneration reaching approximately R$ 8.7 billion in dividends and JCP, plus approximately R$ 2.5 billion from the bonus share issue.
Itaú (ITUB4) will release its 4Q25 results after market close on 2026-02-04.
Itaúsa PN (ITSA4) will release its next balance sheet on 2026-03-15, projecting revenue of R$ 4.34B.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Itaúsa's high dividend yield of 14.47% and recurring ROE of approximately 18% make it an attractive investment. The company's recurring quarterly net profit is around R$ 4.1 billion, with an annual profit growth of approximately 6%.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Analysts estimate valuation at R$ 12.75 - R$ 13.12, while the current price is R$ 13.89 (2026-01-29). The P/VP ratio is 1.64 and P/L is 9.42, which may indicate overvaluation.

summary_markdown: ITSA4 is currently priced at R$ 13.89 (2026-01-29). Analysts estimate valuation at R$ 12.75 - R$ 13.12. Key metrics include a P/VP of 1.64, P/L of 9.42, ROE of 16.52%, Dividend Yield of 14.47%, and a payout of 83.14%. Itaúsa announced a bonus share issue on 2025-12-15 and dividend/JCP payments on 2025-12-09, with total shareholder remuneration reaching ~R$ 8.7 billion. A capital increase to R$ 83,689,000,000.00 occurred on 2025-12-15. Itaú (ITUB4) will release its 4Q25 results on 2026-02-04, and Itaúsa PN (ITSA4) will release its next balance sheet on 2026-03-15, projecting revenue of R$ 4.34B. The company has a recurring quarterly net profit of ~R$ 4.1 billion, ~6% annual profit growth, and ~18% recurring ROE. Net debt is less than R$ 700 million.
